verses.verse: (1 Against the Priests and rulers of Israel.13 The help of man is in vain.) O ye Priests, hear this, and hearken ye, O house of Israel, and give ye ear, O house of the King: for judgment is toward you, because you have been a (The Priests and Princes caught the poor people in their snares, as the fowlers did the birds, in these two high mountains.) snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.

Yet they were profound to decline to (Notwithstanding they seemed to be given altogether to holiness, and to sacrifices which here he calleth slaughter in contempt.) slaughter, though I have been a (Though I had admonished them continually by my Prophets.) rebuker of them all.

I know (They boasted themselves not only to be Israelites, but also Ephraimites, because their king Jeroboam came of that tribe.) Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou art become an harlot, and Israel is defiled.
They will not give their minds to turn unto their God: for the spirit of fornication is in the midst of them, and they have not known the Lord.
And the (Meaning, their contemning of all admonitions.) pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity: Judah also shall fall with them.
They shall go with their sheep, and with their bullocks, to seek the Lord: but they shall not find him: for he hath withdrawn himself from them.

They have transgressed against the Lord: for they have begotten (That is, their children are degenerate, so that there is no hope in them.) strange children: now shall (Their destruction is not far off.) a month devour them with their portions.

Blow ye the trumpet in Gibeah, and the shame in Ramah: cry out at Beth Aven, after thee, O (That is, all Israel comprehended under this part, signifying that the Lord’s plagues should pursue them from place to place till they were destroyed.) Benjamin.
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I caused to (By the success they shall know that I have surely determined this.) know the truth.
The princes of Judah were like them that (They have turned upside down all political order and all manner of religion.) remove the bound: therefore will I pour out my wrath upon them like water.
Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after the (To wit, after king Jeroboam’s commandment, and did not rather follow God.) commandment.
Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as a rottenness.

When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his wound, then went Ephraim unto (Instead of seeking for remedy at God’s hand.) Assyria, and sent unto King (Who was king of the Assyrians.) Jareb: yet could he not heal you, nor cure you of your wound.
For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a lion’s whelp, to the house of Judah: I, even I will spoil and go away: I will take away, and none shall rescue it.
I will go, and return to my place, till they acknowledge their fault, and seek me: in their affliction, they will seek me diligently.
